title: Global Third-party Logistics Market Size To Worth USD 2247.95 Billion By 2032 | CAGR of 8.3% - GlobeNewswire
summary: The Global Third-party Logistics Market is projected to grow significantly from USD 1,012.75 Billion in 2022 to USD 2,247.95 Billion by 2032, reflecting a CAGR of 8.3%. The article details the various aspects of Third-party Logistics (3PL), including market segmentation by service and transport modes, along with regional growth trends, particularly in Asia-Pacific. It highlights the importance of outsourcing logistics to improve efficiency and reduce costs for companies, alongside discussing key players and recent developments in the industry.

business_innovation: TRUE, it describes a strategic business arrangement where companies are outsourcing their logistics and supply chain functions to specialized providers, thus representing a new and improved business process in logistics.

likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 488510 - Freight Transportation Arrangement, 493110 - General Warehousing and Storage, 541614 - Process, Physical Distribution, and Logistics Consulting Services, 484121 - General Freight Trucking, Long-Distance, Truckload
